data: SPINE Enhanced Recovery After Surgery (ERAS) Pre Operative (Pre Anesthesia Clinic)

Patient to shower evening prior and cleanse skin with chlorhexidine gluconate 2% wipes (SAGE-Antiseptic Body Cleanser). If chlorhexidine gluconate 2% wipes not available instruct patient to shower on evening prior to *AND* on morning of surgery.
Instruct patient to have no food after midnight on the night before surgery.May drink clear fluids after midnight until one hour before hospital check-in time.
Carbohydrate Loading is not applicable for diabetic patients on insulin.
One hour before hosptial check-in time: drink 1 glass (250 ml) of clear juice (eg. apple juice) or 1 package of PREcovery (diluted package in 400 ml water and drink over 20 minutes)
Patients receiving anticoagulation/antiplatelet agents to be assessed by anaesthesiologist or surgeon for  discontinuation and/or heparin bridging as necessary
Instruct patient to Take prescribed morning medications with clear fluids, as instructed, 1 hour before hospital check-in time. Please see instructions from ACC with regard to medications
Instruct patient to Stop NSAIDS 3 days prior to surgery - e.g. diclofenac (VOLTARIN EQUIV), celecoxib (CELEBREX EQUIV),  ibuprofen (MOTRIN EQUIV.), naproxen (ALEVE)
Instruct patient to Stop ASA (80 or 81 mg) 7 days prior to surgery unless given other directions by Anesthesiology.
Please refer to Pre-Admission Clinic Pre-Operative Test Orders before placing lab orders.
Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
ERAS Post-op (posterior approach; 1, 2, or 3 level fusions; thoracic, lumbar, or sacral levels)
Non-ERAS Post-op (anterior approach; 4 or more level fusions; cervical levels; deformity
Consider consult with Endocrinology if A1c greater than 8.5%, fax referral to 604-875-5995
Consider consult with Perioperative Internal Medicine, and Anesthesiology
